content:
• Tuesday, November 20, 2018
  • SE

    Sea Limited -1.7% as Q3 revenues beat amid higher costs

    • Sea Limited (NYSE:SE) is 1.7% lower after posting its Q3 earnings, where revenues beat expectations and the company boosted full-year guidance.
    • Revenues grew 60% but sharply higher costs nearly halved gross profit (to $5.6M from $10.8M), and operating loss swelled to $246.2M from $160.7M.
    • Net loss was 64% higher, at $218M.
    • Revenue by segment: Digital Entertainment, $112.5M (up 41%); E-commerce, $65.9M (up 2,266%); Digital financial services, $2.55M (down 46.8%); other services, $23.9M (up 256.3%).
    • It's raising full-year guidance for revenue of $930M-$970M (68%-75.2% growth) from a previous $780M-$820M (40.9%-48.1% growth); revenue for digital entertainment is forecast at $600M-$620M (21-25% growth).
    • The company also raised guidance for e-commerce GMV, to $9.2B-$9.7B (123.7%-135.9% growth) from a previous $8.2B-$8.7B.
    • Conference call to come at 7 p.m. ET.
    • Previously: Sea beats on revenue (Nov. 20 2018)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:45 PM
  • BILI

    Bilibili -4.4% after Q3 results show aggressive growth

    • Bilibili (NASDAQ:BILI) has turned lower after hours, down 4.4%, after its Q3 earnings showed a beat on revenues that grew 48% Y/Y but amid sharply higher costs for personnel and marketing to feed growth.
    • Adjusted net loss was substantially wider -- to 202.7M yuan (about $29.5M) from a loss of 2.9M yuan -- but EPS of -0.10 was in line with expectations.
    • Revenues were 1.079B yuan (about $157.1M); revenues from mobile games rose to 744M yuan, up 24%, due to more paying users.
    • Meanwhile, revenues from live broadcasting and value-added services rose 292% to 169.4M yuan; advertising revenues rose 179% to 137.3M yuan; and other revenues fell 20% to 28.1M yuan.
    • In operating metrics, average monthly active users hit 92.7M (up 25%) and mobile MAUs were 80M (up 33%).
    • Average monthly paying users rose 202% to 3.5M; average MPUs for mobile games rose 23%, to 0.9M.
    • For Q4, it's guiding to revenues of 1.04B-1.08B yuan.
    • Conference call to come at 8 p.m. ET.
    • Previously: Bilibili EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Nov. 20 2018)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM | 3 Comments
  • NKE

    Nike gains after Foot Locker beats

    • Nike (NYSE:NKE) is up 1.7% in AH trading after Foot Locker reports comparable sales growth in Q3 ahead of estimates (+2.9% vs. +2 consensus%).
    • It's nothing new for Nike, which often gets a kick up or down following Foot Locker earnings.
    • Previously: Foot Locker +11.7% as comp sales, profits top consensus (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • DXCM

    Dexcom giving $250M in stock to Verily in amended license deal

    • In a filing, Dexcom (NASDAQ:DXCM) notes it's entered an amended licensing agreement with Verily, the life sciences unit of Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), with an eye to speeding up Dexcom's work in Type 2 diabetes.
    • The amendment also improves future profitability for Dexcom, the company said.
    • It strengthens product development timelines for the second-generation CGM system; increases synergy with Verily's Onduo franchise, which makes Dexcom the preferred CGM device supplier; expanded options to collaborate on additional products and software; and scraps royalty payments that Dexcom would have owed.
    • Dexcom will make an initial payment of $250M in stock, and additional payments of up to $280M may be due and payable with product launch and revenue milestones; up to $275M of the milestone payments may be made in stock as well.
    • After hours: DXCM -1.5%; GOOG -0.3%; GOOGL -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 11 Comments
  • FL

    Foot Locker, Autodesk and Baozun among after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: FL +11.8%. SURF +11.0%. HIFR +8.4%. BJ +7.2%. ADSK +6.9%.
    • Top Losers: ONCE -3.1%. SIEN -2.7%. CRTO -2.1%. BZUN -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 8 Comments
  • BJ

    BJ's +7% after earnings shine

    • BJ's Wholesale Club (NYSE:BJ) soars after Q3 results top estimates on revenue growth of 4.4%.
    • Merchandise comparable sales (ex-gas) increased 1.9% during the quarter and merchandise margin was up 60 bps Y/Y.
    • The retailer also generated EBITDA of $149M vs. $141M consensus.
    • CEO update: "We continue to execute against our strategic priorities and have now delivered eleven consecutive quarters of improved profitability and five quarters of positive comp sales. We are still in the very early stages of our transformation and have significant opportunities ahead."
    • Shares of BJ's are up 7.2% in AH trading to $21.25 after shedding 1.2% during the regular session.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • DL

    China Distance Education reports Q4 results

    • China Distance Education (NYSE:DL): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.094; GAAP EPS of $0.072.
    • Revenue of $53.63M (+28.6% Y/Y)
    • Shares +2.99% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • VNET

    Data-center firm 21Vianet +6.6% after Q3 beat

    • Data-center services firm 21Vianet Group (NASDAQ:VNET) is up 6.6% in light after-hours trading following a beat in its Q3 earnings where it trimmed net losses substantially on revenues that grew in renminbi terms.
    • Gross profit rose 11.1% to 241.2M yuan (about $35.1M); gross margin fell slightly to 27.7% from 28.6%, amid an increase in depreciation.
    • Net revenues rose 14.6% to 870.1M yuan (about $126.7M) amid healthy demand.
    • In operational looks, hosting MRR per cabinet was up to 8,384 yuan from 7,817. total cabinets under management rose to 30,303 from last quarter's 29,149; utilization rate was stable at 71.1%.
    • For Q4, it's guiding to net revenues of 870M-890M yuan, and EBITDA of 245M-265M yuan. For the full year, it's forecasting revenues of 3.37B-3.39B yuan (up 13.6% at the midpoint) and EBITDA of 905M-925M yuan (up 36.4% at the midpoint).
    • Conference call to come at 8 p.m. ET.
    • Previously: 21Vianet Group beats by $0.05, beats on revenue (Nov. 20 2018)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon Alexa's Bluetooth SDK now widely available

    • Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Alexa Mobile Accessory Kit is now widely available to developers particularly those making Bluetooth headphones, headsets, and wearables.
    • The SDK was first announced in January with support for Bluetooth headphones from Bose, Sony, and Jabra. Now more manufacturers can join in on the fun.
    • Developers won't need to create a skill or app because the SDK allows the device to communicate directly with Alexa's app.
    • Qualcomm released a smart headset with Alexa reference design as a quick-start for manufacturers.
    • Previously: Amazon announces dev kit to bring Alexa to wearables (Jan. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM | 7 Comments
  • KEYS

    Keysight +6% on Q4 beats, upside guide

    • Keysight (NYSE:KEYS) gains 5.8% on Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with $1.01 and $1.05B (+20% Y/Y), respectively. Upside Q1 guidance has revenue from $965M to $985M (consensus: $964M) and EPS of $0.76 to $0.82 (consensus: $0.75).
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Keysight beats by $0.11, beats on revenue (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • HIFR

    InfraREIT +4.4% after getting possibly superior offer to Oncor deal

    • InfraREIT (NYSE:HIFR) jumps 4.4% in after-hours trading after determining an acquisition proposal it received is "reasonably likely" to lead to a "superior proposal" under its agreement with Oncor Electric Delivery Co.
    • InfraREIT is now allowed to enter further talks and negotiations with the potential counterparty.
    • InfraREIT's conflicts committee hasn't determined that the new proposal is superior and hasn't changed its recommendation on the Oncor transaction.
    • The new acquisition proposal is subject to several conditions, including completion of due diligence, the negotiation of definitive agreements with InfraREIT, Sharyland Utilities, and affiliates of Hunt Consolidated, as applicable, and the approval of the potential counterparty's board.
    • Sempra Energy (NYSE:SRE) is an owner of about 80% of Oncor.
    • Previously: Sempra Energy in deal for InfraREIT (Oct. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • ADSK

    Autodesk +7.7% on Subscription-driven beats, upside guide

    • Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) gains 7.7% aftermarket on Q3 results that beat EPS estimates with $0.29 and revenue estimates with $660.9M (+28% Y/Y). Upside Q4 guidance has revenue from $700M to $710M (consensus: $689.1M) and EPS from $0.40 to $0.44 (consensus: $0.40).
    • Revenue breakdown: Subscription, $481.3M (consensus: $469.6M); Maintenance, $160.1M (consensus: $146.1M).
    • Total ARR was $2.53B (+31% Y/Y, constant currency) with subscription ARR at $1.93B (+105%).
    • Total subscriptions increased 143K (consensus: 127.2K) from Q2 to 4.08M. Subscription plan subscribers grew 252K to 3.12M. 71K maintenance subscribers converted to product subscriptions.
    • Billings were up 30% to $654M.
    • Acquisition: Autodesk will pay $875M net of cash for construction productivity software company PlanGrid.
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Autodesk beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • FL

    Foot Locker +11.7% as comp sales, profits top consensus

    • Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) is up 11.7% following a profit topper in its Q3 results with solid comps.
    • Net income rose to $130M from a year-ago $102M, and EPS of $0.95 cleared consensus for $0.92.
    • Comparable store sales rose 2.9%, beating analyst expectations for a 2% gain.
    • Overall, sales dropped 0.5% to $1.86B; excluding foreign exchange effects, they rose 0.4%, and a 53rd-week impact reduced sales by about $60M in Q3.
    • Gross margin also rose ahead of expectations, to 31.6% from 31%; SG&A expense rate rose to 21.4% from 19.7%.
    • The company opened 10 new stores, remodeled/relocated 13 stores, and closed 20 in Q3; as of Nov. 3, it operated 3,266 stores in 26 countries, and 108 franchised stores operated in the Middle East, along with 10 franchised Runners Point stores in Germany.
    • Meanwhile, merchandise inventories were down 0.6% to $1.305B. Cash and equivalents were $748M vs. debt of $124M.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Previously: Foot Locker beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Nov. 20 2018)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 14 Comments
  • KEYS

    Keysight beats by $0.11, beats on revenue

    • Revenue of $1.05B (+19.6% Y/Y) beats by $30M.
    • Shares +3.24%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 6 Comments
  • BJ

    BJ’s Wholesale Club beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • Revenue of $3.22B (+4.5% Y/Y) beats by $50M.
    • Shares +2%.
    • Press Release

    Foot Locker beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Revenue of $1.86B (-0.5% Y/Y) beats by $10M.

  • ADSK

    Autodesk beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.02; GAAP EPS of -$0.11 misses by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $660.9M (+28.3% Y/Y) beats by $20M.
    • Shares +6%.

    | 4:06 PM | 5 Comments
  • CVS

    WSJ: Walgreens, Humana discussing stakes in each other

    • Walgreens Boots Alliance (WBA -2.9%) and Humana (HUM -2.4%) are in early talks to take equity stakes in each other, the latest potential tie-up in the quickly shifting sands around drugstores and insurers.
    • The two already partner on serving seniors, a venture that could be expanded by the current discussions, the report says.
    • A closer financial connection could replicate some of the expected benefits from a rival tie-up between CVS (NYSE:CVS) and Aetna (NYSE:AET).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 12 Comments
  • NAVI

    Navient -10% as audit suggests deception

    • Navient (NASDAQ:NAVI) plunges after an AP report says an ongoing government audit is finding deceptive practices that may have led to thousands of borrowers choosing higher-cost plans.
    • The audit reportedly shows that Navient steered borrowers into the plans without discussing other options that might have cost less over time and did so to boost profits.
    • The AP says it received a copy of the audit from the office of Senator Elizabeth Warren, a Navient critic.
    • NAVI shares are down 9.6% to $10.85.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 8 Comments
  • HIMX

    Roth steps to Himax sidelines

    • Roth Capital downgrades Himax (NASDAQ:HIMX) from Buy to Neutral.
    • Earlier this month, Himax reported mixed Q3 results with an upside profit guidance.
    • HIMX is down 3.2% to $4.00.
    • Previously: Himax reports mixed Q3, upside Q4 profit guide (Nov. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 15 Comments
  • CNET

    ChinaNet Online posts revenue growth, wider loss

    • ChinaNet Online (CNET -4.8%) grew revenues by more than 26% in Q3 results but losses in part due to asset impairment.
    • Revenues grew to $17M from $13.5M; Search engine marketing and data service revenues were up 29% to $14.5M.
    • Gross profit declined amid higher cost of revenues to $0.4M.
    • Meanwhile, operating loss rose to $3.4M from a previous $2M, and net loss widened to $3M from a loss of $2.1M.
    • Cash and equivalents were $5.9M, double the total from Dec. 31. Advances from customers were $2M as of quarter's end.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • CNET

    ChinaNet Online posts revenue growth, wider loss

    • ChinaNet Online (CNET -4.8%) grew revenues by more than 26% in Q3 results but losses in part due to asset impairment.
    • Revenues grew to $17M from $13.5M; Search engine marketing and data service revenues were up 29% to $14.5M.
    • Gross profit declined amid higher cost of revenues to $0.4M.
    • Meanwhile, operating loss rose to $3.4M from a previous $2M, and net loss widened to $3M from a loss of $2.1M.
    • Cash and equivalents were $5.9M, double the total from Dec. 31. Advances from customers were $2M as of quarter's end.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM

  • Bounce failing, stocks head back toward lows

    • The Nasdaq had managed to trim its loss to just about 0.75% earlier this afternoon, but the bears have re-taken control. Less than an hour before the close, the Nasdaq is down 2.2%, the S&P 500 2.1%, and DJIA 2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 25 Comments
  • ANY

    Oi S.A., Kulicke and Soffa Industries and Maxar Technologies among notable tech movers

    • Gainers: Sphere 3D Corp. (NASDAQ:ANY) +51%. Zedge (NYSEMKT:ZDGE) +25%. Summit Wireless Technologies (WISA) +11%. Kulicke and Soffa Industries (NASDAQ:KLIC) +9%. Blonder Tongue Laboratories (NYSEMKT:BDR) +7%.
    • Losers: Oi S.A. (NYSE:OIBR.C) -28%. FTE Networks (NYSEMKT:FTNW) -18%. Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) -13%. Maxar Technologies (NYSE:MAXR) -12%. SMTC (NASDAQ:SMTX) -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • NVS

    FDA warns about severe worsening of MS related to Novartis' Gilenya

    • Novartis (NVS -1.6%) turns lower after the Food and Drug Administration says it is adding a new warning to the prescribing information of the drug label and patient medication guide for the Gilenya multiple sclerosis medicine.
    • The FDA says when Gilenya (fingolimod) is stopped, the disease can become much worse than before the medicine was started or while it was being taken, adding the worsening  of the MS is rare but can result in permanent disability.
    • Gilenya is one of several medicines approved to treat a form of MS called relapsing MS, which are periods of time when MS symptoms get worse.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • JEC

    Jacobs Engineering -10% after guidance disappoints

    • Jacobs Engineering (JEC -9.6%) falls sharply after guiding for Q1 EPS of $0.85 to $1.15 vs. $1.28 consensus.
    • The company's Q4 revenue tally also arrived short of estimates.
    • CEO update: "We delivered strong revenue growth and gross and operating profit margin percentage increases over 130 basis points year-over-year in the quarter. Our Q4 adjusted cash flow from operations continued to be healthy at over $250M, when excluding a $50M voluntary pension payment... Following our strong performance in 2018, we continue to expect $920M to $1B in adjusted EBITDA, excluding the ECR results for FY19."
    • JEC trades at its lowest level since July.
    • Previously: Jacobs Engineering beats by $0.07, misses on revenue (Nov. 20)
    • Previously: More on Jacobs Engineering's FQ4 (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • MYL

    Mylan lower after FDA warning

    • "Recently, the FDA issued a warning letter to Mylan Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MYL) for CGMP violations," tweets FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb. "We expect the firm to work to resolve the issues identified by the FDA."
    • Mylan notes the issues relate to its manufacturing facility in Morgantown, West Virginia, and the action is the result of previously disclosed observations of that plant.
    • Remediation is underway, and the company has discontinued several products from that site, while transferring some to other sites.
    • Shares are down 1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • ROST

    Ross Stores down 8% after light profit guidance

    • Ross Stores (ROST -8.3%) trades lower despite topping estimates with its Q3 EPS and comparable sales tallies.
    • Investors may have their eyes on Ross' profit view for the crucial holiday quarter after the retailer guided for EPS of $1.02 to $1.07 vs. $1.08 consensus.
    • The share price decline for Ross Stores coincides with a bruising for the retail sector as a whole, led by a 10% drop for Target.
    • Previously: Ross Stores beats by $0.02, revenue in-line (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 8 Comments
  • NAK

    Northern Dynasty +9% after securing right of way deal for Pebble site access

    • Northern Dynasty Minerals (NAK +9.3%) surges as much as 13% after saying the Pebble Partnership had finalized a right-of-way agreement with Alaska Peninsula Corp., an Alaska Native village corporation with extensive land holdings near the Pebble Project site.
    • NAK says the agreement secures access to the Pebble Project site for construction and operation of the proposed mine and "represents a significant milestone in the developing relationship between Pebble and the Alaska Native people of the region."
    • NAK shares have climbed more than 50% this month, also benefiting from the election of a new Alaska governor considered likely to support development of the Pebble Project.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 37 Comments
  • SDRL

    Seadrill leads the losers in Energy/Material sector

    • Gainers: None.
    • Losers: Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) -15%. Sanchez Midstream Partners (NYSEMKT:SNMP) -13%. Ultra Petroleum (NASDAQ:UPL) -13%. Golden Star Resources (NYSEMKT:GSS) -13%. Denbury Resources (NYSE:DNR) -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 3 Comments
  • DISCA

    Discovery adds former Scripps networks to app lineup

    • Discovery (DISCA -2.6%) has made former Scripps Networks channels available via its suite of Discovery GO apps, the "TV Everywhere" approach allowing for mobile viewing by authenticated pay TV subscribers.
    • HGTV, Food Network, Travel Channel, DIY and Cooking Channel are joining 12 existing Discovery GO apps.
    • The move brings more than 22,000 titles into a platform that now numbers 45,000 titles systemwide.
    • The apps are available on iOS/Android, Apple TV, Roku, Fire TV, Chromecast, Xbox One, Samsung TV and on the Web.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • EADSY

    Reuters: Airbus set to name new finance, operations leaders

    • Airbus (EADSY -1.8%) is set to name leadership for finance and operations in a bit of housecleaning amid lengthy corruption probes, and following a cut to its core delivery target, Reuters reports.
    • Incoming CEO Guillaume Faury is set to bring in a fresh face to replace German CFO Harald Wilhelm, who said in May that he'd leave next spring, at the same time as current CEO Tom Enders.
    • Tom Williams, chief operating officer of the main planemaking business, could also be replaced, according to the report.
    • Amid British and French investigations into the use of middlemen in jet sales, Wilhelm hasn't been accused of wrongdoing (and he initiated Airbus' decision to end the system of middlemen supporting jet sales), but a replacement CFO could help Airbus win more leniency in court.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • STKS

    Piper Jaffray sees +40% upside on The One Group Hospitality

    • Piper Jaffray initiates coverage on The ONE Group Hospitality (STKS -0.4%) with a Buy rating and price target of $4 (+40% upside potential).
    • After shooting up +5% following the PJ upgrade, STKS is now back down into a negative territory amid a broad market decline.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • NOAH

    Noah Holdings leads financial gainers; Aegon N.V. and Farmland Partners among losers

    • Gainers: Noah Holdings (NYSE:NOAH) +12%. Hexindai (NASDAQ:HX) +5%.
    • Losers: Warrior Met Coal (NYSE:HCC) -8%. eXp World Holdings (NASDAQ:EXPI) -6%. Aegon N.V. (NYSE:AEG) -6%. Security National Financial (NASDAQ:SNFCA) -6%. Farmland Partners (NYSE:FPI) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • BHP

    Report: BHP should catch up on iron ore shipments despite derailment

    • BHP (BHP -2.9%) should recoup lost iron ore shipments from Port Hedland over the remainder of this calendar year and stay on track to hit production guidance, Argus reports, following the derailment of a runaway train filled with iron ore earlier this month.
    • BHP has been ramping up rail services over the past week despite some safety concerns related to the trains, according to the report.
    • Argus calculates loadings for the Nov. 6-19 period fell 22% vs. the same period in October and by 30% from the same period in November last year; while this may seem like a large fall, BHP should be able to make up for it over the next 6-8 weeks, assuming there are no other technical issues and the weather remains benign.
    • BHP undertook major maintenance work on its Port Hedland facilities in July, which should position it to push extra tonnage through the port in the coming weeks, and has spent much of the past year debottlenecking its rail system, while stockpiles at the mines will have been built up to ensure swift supply of ore into the rail system as soon as it is back up and running.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • SGBAF

    Intelsat, partners press FCC for action on mid-band spectrum plan

    • Intelsat (I -2.7%) and its partners in the push to sell access to mid-band satellite airwaves, including SES (OTCPK:SGBAF), are pressing the FCC to wrap up consideration of its plan "as soon as possible."
    • The C-Band Alliance also include Eutelsat (EUTLY -3.1%) and Telesat (LORL -1.8%), and the plan is backed by Intel (INTC -0.9%).
    • The group's eager to move forward with repurposing its airwaves for wireless carrier use and potential 5G development, though, according to a filing detailing a staff meeting. Reps for the satellite firms have reiterated a target of clearing 200 MHz within 18-36 months of a final FCC order. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Previously: RBC raises satellite targets on boost to mid-band spectrum value (Oct. 25 2018)
    • Previously: Satellite alliance boosts plan for monetizing spectrum (Oct. 23 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 3 Comments
  • SPG

    Landlords lower as retail names tank

    • Reasonable quarterly results from the likes of Target, Kohl's, Best Buy, TJX, and Lowe's aren't preventing major selling in those names, as well as the likes of Walmart, Gap, Ross Stores, and other big brick & mortar names.
    • Retail landlords are mostly underperforming in the REIT sector (IYR -0.9%) today: Simon Property (SPG -1.9%), Tanger Factory (SKT -1.1%), Macerich (MAC -2.4%), PREIT (PEI -1.2%), CBL (CBL -2.4%), Washington Prime (WPG -2.2%), Taubman Centers (TCO -3.5%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 26 Comments
  • ANY

    Microcaps dominate midday movers

    • Gainers: Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) +52%. NF Energy Saving (NASDAQ:NFEC) +24%. Zedge (NYSEMKT:ZDGE) +19%. Summit Wireless Technologies (WISA) +15%. Bioblast Pharma (NASDAQ:ORPN) +15%. Dogness (NASDAQ:DOGZ) +14%. Kulicke and Soffa Industries (NASDAQ:KLIC) +14%. Innovate Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:INNT) +12%. AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACRX) +11%. Pinduoduo (NASDAQ:PDD) +12%.
    • Losers: Oi S.A. (NYSE:OIBR.C) -24%. Microbot Medical (NASDAQ:MBOT) -17%. Limbach Holdings (NASDAQ:LMB) -17%. Tarena International (NASDAQ:TEDU) -16%. Eastside Distilling (NASDAQ:EAST) -15%. LivaNova (NASDAQ:LIVN) -15%. TDH Holdings (NASDAQ:PETZ) -14%. Eros International (NYSE:EROS) -14%. L Brands (NYSE:LB) -13%. Dynagas LNG Partners (NYSE:DLNG) -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 6 Comments
  • XOM

    Energy sector sinks as U.S. crude oil falls to new one-year low

    • The S&P energy sector (XLE -2.6%) supplants tech as the stock market's worst performer, as U.S. crude oil futures sink to fresh one-year lows, falling alongside stocks as investors dump risk assets; WTI -5% at $54.35/bbl, Brent -5.1% at $63.38/bbl.
    • "When the stock market comes off 8%-9%, it tends to conjure up images of a weak global economy and that feeds into expectations of weaker than expected oil demand," says Jim Ritterbusch of Ritterbusch and Associates.
    • Expectations for a ninth straight week of U.S. crude inventory increases also weigh on prices; seven analysts polled ahead of today's data from the American Petroleum Institute estimates crude stocks rose 2.1M barrels last week.

  • TWTR

    Twitter apologizes for CEO's viral moment in India

    • Twitter (TWTR -1.8%) has apologized for a social media row kicked up in India, where a picture of CEO Jack Dorsey holding a poster with the phrase "smash Brahminical patriarchy" went viral.
    • The company says Twitter held a closed-door discussion during which a low-caste Dalit woman shared her experience. At the end, she gave Dorsey the poster, referring to the highest Hindu caste.
    • Several prominent Indians have charged Dorsey with "hate-mongering," including former Infosys finance chief T.V. Mohandas Pai.
    • “I’m very sorry for this. It’s not reflective of our views. We took a private photo with a gift just given to us -- we should have been more thoughtful,” tweeted Vijaya Gadde, legal, policy and trust and safety lead at Twitter.
    • Twitter doesn't break out user numbers for India but says the country is one of its fastest-growing areas.

    • The analyst noted rapid smartphone demand deterioration in China in a note on October 15 but now sees additional twists.
    • Hall: "It also looks like the balance of price and features in the iPhone XR may not have been well-received by users outside of the US."
    • Hall says the two-week period starting a week before Christmas day has historically provided a disproportionate chunk of December quarter demand, which could change the iPhone demand picture. But Hall doesn't expect this to happen.

    Exxon slips after Raymond James downgrades; says among least appealing plays on bullish oil call

    • Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM) -1.8% pre-market after Raymond James downgrades shares to Underperform from Market Perform, calling it "one of the least appealing ways to play our bullish oil call, particularly after the painful but in our view transitory oil price selloff over the past month."
    • Ray Jay's Pavel Molchanov says XOM has second-lowest correlation with Brent oil among mega-caps, which outweighs the free cash flow story and potential uplift from IMO 2020.
    • Molchanov says XOM is viewed by investors as "ultra-defensive" as it has limited leverage to oil prices given its "significant overweight" in downstream and chemicals.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM | 49 Comments
  • SNAP

    Report: Snap readying higher-priced two-camera Spectacles

    • Snap (NYSE:SNAP) will very shortly release a new, higher-priced version of its Spectacles glasses, Cheddar reports.
    • The company will have new glasses internally code-named "Newport" out by the end of the year, featuring two cameras and a price point of $350 that's more than double the cost of the first version.
    • With two cameras, the new Spectacles can overlay augmented reality lenses, and create 3D-like photo effects from footage they capture.
    • After a $40M writedown on the first version, Snap significantly reduced the number of pairs it ordered for version 2 of Spectacles, released seven months ago (to about 35,000 pairs); the company plans to make about 24,000 of the new high-priced two-camera version, Cheddar's Alex Heath says.
    • Shares are off 3.6% premarket; they fell 6.8% yesterday.
    • Previously: Report shows Snap's Spiegel unworried by Wall Street; shares -7.2% (Nov. 19 2018)
    • Previously: Snap's content VP latest to exit company amid reorg (Nov. 12 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 11 Comments

  • CBRL

    Cracker Barrel -1.5% after Maxim cut

    • Cracker Barrel Old Country Stores (NASDAQ:CBRL) is lower in early trading after Maxim Group downgrades the retailer to a Hold rating from Buy on a valuation call.
    • Shares of CBRL are up 15% over the last 90 days, taking valuation to Maxim's dropping off point.
    • Cracker Barrel is due to report earnings on November 27.
    • Cracker Barrel is down 1.46% in premarket trading to $172.30 vs. a 52-week trading range of $141.63 to $179.12.
